DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Minor Salivary Gland Anatomic Subsite Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The location of the minor salivary gland from which the specimen was collected.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Minor Salivary Gland Anatomic Subsite
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A small salivary gland located in the oral cavity. It produces saliva._Relating to anatomy._A position within another named site.
